item.title: Communication is a Game Developer's greatest skill
item.description: I must admit that this article was originally conceived because of a frustrating experience I just couldn’t let go.

item.title: Hard Lessons Learned from Bombgoggles
item.description: This summer, I participated in ~10 game jams. Most of the games I submitted ended up quite good and received high ratings.

item.title: The Problem of Dreamshrink
item.description: Every idea for a creative project starts full of opportunities. This is nice. You feel motivated, you’re interested to see where all these ideas lead, and you feel creatively fulfilled.

item.title: Every Game is a Distribution Problem
item.description: I’ll try to keep this article brief, because the title has already given the big insight that I want to share.

item.title: Game Dev: How to prioritize?
item.description: This article is another one that came out of my recent “summer of game jams”. I participated in 10 game jams, which was indeed stressful and a lot of work, but also taught me a lot.

item.title: Game Dev: What are you telling players?
item.description: Recently, I decided to take a short break during the summer and participate in a few game jams again.

item.title: The Summer of Game Jams (2024)
item.description: In the summer of 2024, I quite spontaneously participated in 10 game jams over a period of a few weeks.

item.title: The Story Told by Mini-Games
item.description: I have always played two types of video games. About 10% of them are strategical simulations such as Rollercoaster Tycoon (and recently Parkitect, of course), and the other 90% are local coop games such as Overcooked and Towerfall.

item.title: Should you let your kids win?
item.description: A recurring issue when playing games is a skill gap. This is most common when parents play a game with their kids, but also happens for example when people with different levels of gaming experience (in general) approach a game.

item.title: Why rules should be less strict
item.description: I’ve been learning, explaining, testing and designing board games for a long while now. You can comfortably call me a real gamer, a “seasoned gamer”, a heavy gamer.

item.title: Finding Fonts & Licensing
item.description: This article is about how to deal with fonts when it comes to creative projects. I explain where I find my fonts, but mostly about licensing and things to look out for.

item.title: Why I created "The Peerful Project"
